news_header: Alphabet is increasing its AI infrastructure spending significantly, following trends set by Microsoft and Meta, despite market concerns over earnings.
news_original_title: Mag 7 Members Report Strong Earnings, Double Down on CapEx
news_text: Alphabet has joined the Mag 7 club by committing to a 47% increase in its capital expenditures for AI infrastructure, totaling $75 billion. This follows similar aggressive spending plans from Microsoft and Meta. Despite a drop in Alphabet's stock post-earnings release, the company reported a 28.3% increase in Q4 earnings. The tech sector is expected to continue its growth trajectory, with double-digit earnings growth anticipated for the next two years, even without the contribution from the Mag 7 group.
